channel.title: Towards a new SRL home
channel.description:
Hi, monitoring events :)
You have done what I asked: You have choosen leaders. Good Work!
I will give my SQL database to the new community, since it is a collaberate effort of us all and thus not mine to keep. I will be fully cooperative and provide assistance where needed.
I would advice you to choose more Administrators. Dank and Wizz cant handle events on their own, simply because it is a HELL of a lot of work and they are tied up and they should stay that way. I trust you will divide tasks and stick to those.
Also, I would love to see you keep the SRL Forum-rules as they are, since I consider those my "intellectual property" and with it I unlocked a tremendeous amount of positive creative energy. It will also keep you out of trouble :)
As for the SVN: Yes, keep it Open-Source. Remove the auto-responder if neccesary, or better yet: empty the autoresponder, so you only need to copy paste for private purposes.
P.S.
[eager to tell] I archieved an [b]Ultimate Low Score[/b] during the comedytrain event. I was banned [b]5[/b] times within 35 minutes and I had some interesting conversations with 4 (!) Golden Mods. Appearently the [b]all[/b] knew about me being WT-Fakawi and unleashed their frustration on me personally... I wrote an appeal and the next day (Monday at exactly 09:06) I was unbanned. Thanks Andrew for the respect!
So: I archieved my last goal and proved that Jagex closely monitors development throughout the [b]entire [/b]cheating community. It is offcourse a logical thing to do. Know thy enemies. Example: They changed the Box a bit (tiny offset in numbers) so appearently they had pups code! But in a strange way Jagex seems to respect us too (see above). Though a fragile agreement, it provides some gentleman space to operate. Keep it like that!!!!!!!!!!!![/eager to tell]
No I am not coming back, but I promise to "stick around". I will post each and every script I ever made on the new SRL-Board.
L,
TW-Fawaki erm... Drissyweer.

item.title: Towards a new SRL home
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

me and Fawki have been working hard on the new SRL Forums, unfort i corrupted the base database tryin to import the Villavu Backup… soon as i figure out how to restore the villavu database to my server we will be back in business! if neone has ne mysql help(mopar?) i would love ne help you can provide me with. ATM there is a vBulletin forum with Sat style on it just i fryd the db so ill be back up and goin soon…

Read full topic

WT-Fakawi:

As for the SVN: Yes, keep it Open-Source.

yay!!!

glad to see you still stopping by

item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

New forums are http://dakotastorm.sslpowered.com/dakotastorm.com/SRL-Forum/index.php

I just got them fully working last night

item.title: Towards a new SRL home
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

Sounds good Freddy, and good to see you around Fakawi.
Just let us know when the forums are ready to go Dank

Read full topic

item.title: Towards a new SRL home
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

I’m sure we can manage it, after all, we’re a team
But it somewhat concerns me that Jagex had gotten pups’ code, there are only 2 possible explanations for that…
1 They for it from the nex svn from the first revision…
2 We have a spy (I prefered the first possibility tough)

PS: I do have an idea that could solve or partially solve the problem with the opensourceness…
As prolly no one of you know, I’m very good at writing encryption algorythms (or whatever you spell it), I could (try to) make a program we can use to encrypt files like the autoresponder before we upload em
We can for example give them the extension *.scarenc and make my program it’s default which will decrypt it, save it as a temp scar file somewhere and open it in scar, then we can modify what we want, save it make the program encrypt it and recommit it.

Read full topic

item.title: Towards a new SRL home
item.dc:creator: @Dankness Dankness
item.description:
@Dankness wrote:

Fawaki PM ME on Messenger ill have the forums up soon… heres a tester forums http://www.dakotastorm.com/SRL-Forums/ for now im almost done with them…

BTW Yes me and Wizzup will not be the only Admins in this, I will be probably promoting the 2 of the old SRL Moderators to Admin status like you did with me and Ben back then, don’t woryr ol’ top we’ll keep this thing goin…

Read full topic

item.title: Towards a new SRL home
item.dc:creator: @WT-Fakawi WT-Fakawi
item.description:
@WT-Fakawi wrote:

Hi, monitoring events

You have done what I asked: You have choosen leaders. Good Work!

I will give my SQL database to the new community, since it is a collaberate effort of us all and thus not mine to keep. I will be fully cooperative and provide assistance where needed.

I would advice you to choose more Administrators. Dank and Wizz cant handle events on their own, simply because it is a HELL of a lot of work and they are tied up and they should stay that way. I trust you will divide tasks and stick to those.

Also, I would love to see you keep the SRL Forum-rules as they are, since I consider those my “intellectual property” and with it I unlocked a tremendeous amount of positive creative energy. It will also keep you out of trouble

As for the SVN: Yes, keep it Open-Source. Remove the auto-responder if neccesary, or better yet: empty the autoresponder, so you only need to copy paste for private purposes.

[eager to tell] I archieved an Ultimate Low Score during the comedytrain event. I was banned 5 times within 35 minutes and I had some interesting conversations with 4 (!) Golden Mods. Appearently the all knew about me being WT-Fakawi and unleashed their frustration on me personally… I wrote an appeal and the next day (Monday at exactly 09:06) I was unbanned. So: I archieved my last goal and proved that Jagex closely monitors development throughout the entire cheating community. It is offcourse a logical thing to do. Know thy enemies. Example: They changed the Box a bit (tiny offset in numbers) so appearently they had pups code!
But in a strange way Jagex seems to respect us too (see above). Though a fragile agreement, it provides some gentleman space to operate. Keep it like that!!![/eager to tell]

No I am not coming back, but I promise to “stick around”. I will post each and every script I ever made on the new SRL-Board.
